item.title: SLAI Application
item.description: This passage is a personal record of my PhD application journey. It focuses on the basic requirements of the process and my reflections on participating in it. Application and Exam Preparation I received the application notice from the department and my supervisor at the end of February. Shortly after that, the Shenzhen Loop Area Institute (SLAI) gave a presentation on the first-year student application process. The talk covered the examination details, program benefits, and overall objectives.

item.title: FPSET Course Resource
item.description: Goal This post is specially used for helping students who majored in Fire Protection and Safety Engineering Technology (FPSET) collaborated by SWJTU-OSU to master the knowledge of related fields deeper and quicker. Illustrations These materials have been saved since 2019, and some of them may no longer be effective today. Personally, I hope that you, as students, can use them appropriately as references to help yourself grasp knowledge more quickly. In that case, you would have more choices about your future path.

item.title: Winter Holiday
item.description: English corner is always a perfect place for me to improve my English skill. I’ve taken part in this activity for more than half a year, this place always relax me when I am under pressured by academic researches. Every week I will make the reservation and be there on time. Although each session just lasts for one hour, it’s worthy doing that. I’ve accumulated many words and expressions since then.

item.title: Chitchat
item.description: This article discusses my various thoughts and the information I collected on studying abroad during the process of continuous learning. You are welcome to add to it. Two sides of studying abroad Advantages Bilingual skill More personal time and more efficient Diversified Talents (Cultural Integration) A variety of options Drawbacks Loneliness Cultural differences Lack of domestic relationships Unfamiliarity with the domestic environment (missed campus recruitment, insensitive to the job market, etc.

item.title: UK
item.description: This article is used to record some of the information I have learned during the application process for studying abroad, for your reference. It should be added that I am an academic master in China. Language requirements Basic requirement: IELTS 6.5 (sub-score 6) Advanced requirement: IELTS 7 (sub-score 6.5) Advanced requirement: IELTS 7.5 (sub-score 7) Timeline The following is a rough timeline. It should be noted that the UK does not require GRE, only IELTS scores Material preparation Statement of Purpose Personal Statement (PS) Resume (CV) Letter of recommendation English transcripts of undergraduate and master’s degrees Language scores (TOEFL/IELTS & GRE/GMAT, etc.
